name: Hard The Scarlet Spider Quiz / Test | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Ben Reilly is a clone of which character?
questions.explanation:
Peter Parker.

	It was originally believed that Reilly was the original and that Peter Parker, also known as Spider-Man, was the clone. This was disproven when Ben Reilly died and and dissolved.

questions.text: Which scientist had a hand in Reilly's creation?
questions.explanation:
The Jackal.

	The Jackal is Miles Warren, a geneticist who went insane and created many Spider-Man clones including Reilly, Spider-Cide and Kaine. He died after falling off of a building.

questions.text: While wandering, which disease ailed Reilly?
questions.explanation:
Influenza.

	Reilly got the flu early on in his wandering years, begun after a brief and violent encounter with Peter Parker. He met a doctor named Seward Trainer who helped him recuperate.

questions.text: Where did Reilly work as a teaching assistant?
questions.explanation:
Salt Lake City.

	Trainer's references, although fake, got Reilly a job in Salt Lake City. He was able to make a living and met his first love interest.

questions.text: Reilly met a woman who was a child abuse victim.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The woman who called herself Janine Godbe was really Elizabeth Tyne, an abuse victim who finally lashed out and killed her abusive father. She trusted Reilly enough to disclose the information to him, and he showed her his powers.

questions.text: Who framed Reilly for at least one murder in Salt Lake City?
questions.explanation:
Kaine.

	Kaine was a failed clone of Peter Parker, and resented his more perfect "brothers". Having the same fingerprints as Reilly, he killed people and framed Reilly, making life difficult for the future Scarlet Spider.

questions.text: Why did Reilly return to New York?
questions.explanation:
May Parker was dying.

	Reilly returned to New York City two years after his Salt Lake adventures and found a bitter Parker. The two briefly fought and then resolved their differences.

questions.text: Reilly could sense Venom using his spider-sense.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Unlike Peter Parker's, Reilly's spider-sense is able to track Venom. Reilly used his impact webbing to defeat Venom, one of Spider-Man's most dangerous adversaries!

questions.text: Where did Reilly work during his stint as Spider-Man?
questions.explanation:
The Daily Grind.

	The Daily Grind was a diner that Reilly worked at for a year during his tenure as everyone's favorite web-slinger. Peter Parker took some time off to raise his unborn child.

Green Goblin.

	Reilly jumped in front of the Green Goblin's glider, breaking his spine and crashing into a taxi far below. He dissolved in Peter Parker's arms, finally revealing that he was the clone, not Parker.
